intro: Icacorea luquillensis, commonly known as the Luquillo icacure, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
